title: Check for a Balanced Equation
text: Check if the equation is balanced or not. If not, balance the equation.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$\operatorname{Mg}\left(OH\right) _2$$
text: Use the equation Moles of Reactant A $$=$$ Mass of Reactant A * (Moles of Reactant A)/(Molar Mass of Reactant A).

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$\operatorname{Mg}\left(OH\right) _2$$
text: What is (16 g MgOH_2)*(1 mol $$MgOH_2$$ / $$58.3$$ g MgOH_2)? Keep three decimal places.

title: Identify the Stoichiometric Factor
text: The stoichiometric factor relating the two substances of interest is $$2$$ mol NaOH / $$1$$ mol $$\operatorname{Mg}\left(OH\right) _2$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of NaOH
text: The molar amount of NaOH is derived by multiplying the provided molar amount of $$\operatorname{Mg}\left(OH\right) _2$$ by multiplying the stoichiometric factor.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of NaOH
text: What is $$(0.274$$ mol Mg(OH)_2)*(2 mol NaOH / $$1$$ mol Mg(OH)_2)? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Mass of NaOH
text: Calculate the Mass of NaOH with Mass of Reactant A $$=$$ (Molar Mass of Reactant A)/(Moles of Reactant A)*Moles of Reactant A)

title: Calculate the Mass of NaOH
text: What is $$(0.548$$ mol NaOH)*(40.0 g NaOH)/(mol NaOH)? Give your answer as an integer.
